channel.title: "Frequency Over Range"?
channel.description:
Well, my problem is when I try to configure the settings of the display drivers in linux SUSE... I, for example, turn on 3D acceleration, then test it, and my monitor shows "frequency over range". I know why this shows, so I restarted my computer, went back to the display drivers, and put the sync frequencies all to lowest... yes, the lowest (Horizontal: 30/30. Vertical: 50/60). Now I push test, and it STILL gives me the frequency over range error on my monitor! I restart again, and now I go to the display driver, and not edit ANYTHING, and press test... Same error. Weird...
Is it SUSE 10.1? Does ubunti fix this problem? Do I have to install the ATI (I have an ATI Radeon 9250 Series video card) driver for linux?

item.title: "Frequency Over Range"?
item.dc:creator: @sicarius99 sicarius99
item.description:
@sicarius99 wrote:

yeah ubuntu would have everything working

Read full topic
